methanol, and some higher hydrocarbons 38.In order to test the catalytic capability of our products, methanol was chosen as the target product for the photo-reduction of CO 2 .Fig. 9 shows the methanol yields of the photo-catalysts with the increase of irradiation time.The largest yields of methanol on Cu 2 O and Cu 2 O-RGO photo-catalysts under simulated sunlight irradiation for 10 h were 27.2 and 41.5 molg-cat, respectively.The results clearly indicate that the photo-catalytic performance of Cu 2 O can

were synthesized by the same processes in absence of RGO for comparison. The photo-catalytic activity of the as-prepared catalysts was omeasured by the photo-degradation of Rhodamine B (RhB) solution and the photo-reduction of CO 2 to methanol under the illumination of simulated solar light at ambient temperature. In a typical reaction, 100 mg of the catalyst was dispersed in 100 mL of a 10 mgL RhB solution under ultrasonication for 1 min.Before illumination, the mixture was magnetically stirred for 30 min

by measuring the absorbance of RhB at 553 nm using a spectrophotometer (UV-5200PC, Shanghai Metash).
